title: Paintings, Sculptures and Other Objects Exhibited during the World's Congress
description: The new 1893 lakefront building served for six months as an auxiliary meeting place for several congresses, held in conjunction with the World’s Columbian Exposition. The growing art collection of the museum was on display on the second floor of the new building, and included works from the former Demidoff collection of Old Dutch and Flemish Masters, acquired in 1890.

input: Paintings, Sculptures and Other Objects Exhibited during the World's Congress
